meanings.definition: Produced or brought about by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biogenic waste in the soil helps plants grow.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the biogenic materials found in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The biogenic compost made the garden soil very happy.
meanings.sent4: The biogenic influence of nature can be seen in every living thing.
meanings.sent5: The biogenic process of photosynthesis is essential for life on Earth.

meanings.sent1: The biogenic origin of the fossil was evident from its structure.
meanings.sent2: The medicine contained biogenic compounds extracted from plants.
meanings.sent3: The biogenic source of the river water made it taste extra fresh.
meanings.sent4: Her artwork was a biogenic masterpiece inspired by nature.
meanings.sent5: The biogenic nature of the ecosystem was carefully preserved by the park rangers.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the production or origin of living organisms.
meanings.sent1: The biogenic processes in the ocean support diverse marine life.
meanings.sent2: The biogenic factors influenced the growth of the coral reef.
meanings.sent3: The biogenic theory of evolution fascinated the students.
meanings.sent4: The biogenic cycle of life continues in the rainforest.
meanings.sent5: The biogenic energy of the sun sustains all life on Earth.
